00047 /* FIXME: Type-punning based, may not be efficient. */
00048 #define __rthal_u64tou32(ull, h, l) ({                  \
00049         union { unsigned long long _ull;                \
00050             struct { u_long _h; u_long _l; } _s; } _u;  \
00051         _u._ull = (ull);                                \
00052         (h) = _u._s._h;                                 \
00053         (l) = _u._s._l;                                 \
00054         })
00055 
00056 #define __rthal_u64fromu32(h, l) ({                     \
00057         union { unsigned long long _ull;                \
00058             struct { u_long _h; u_long _l; } _s; } _u;  \
00059         _u._s._h = (h);                                 \
00060         _u._s._l = (l);                                 \
00061         _u._ull;                                        \
00062         })
00063 
00064 static inline unsigned long long rthal_ullmul(const unsigned long m0, 
00065                                               const unsigned long m1)
00066 {
00067     const unsigned long resl = m0 * m1;
00068     unsigned long resh;
00069     
00070     __asm__ ("mulhwu %0, %1, %2"
00071              : "=r" (resh)
00072              : "%r" (m0), "r" (m1));
00073 
00074     return __rthal_u64fromu32(resh, resl);
00075 }
00076 
00077 static inline unsigned long long rthal_ulldiv (unsigned long long ull,
00078                                                const unsigned long uld,
00079                                                unsigned long *const rp)
00080 {
00081 #ifdef __KERNEL__
00082     const unsigned long r = __div64_32(&ull, uld);
00083 #else /* !__KERNEL__ */
00084     const unsigned long r = ull % uld;
00085     ull /= uld;
00086 #endif /* __KERNEL__ */
00087 
00088     if (rp)
00089         *rp = r;
00090 
00091     return ull;
00092 }
00093 
00094 #define rthal_uldivrem(ull,ul,rp) ((u_long) rthal_ulldiv((ull),(ul),(rp)))
00095 
00096 static inline int rthal_imuldiv (int i, int mult, int div) {
00097 
00098     /* Returns (int)i = (unsigned long long)i*(u_long)(mult)/(u_long)div. */
00099     const unsigned long long ull = rthal_ullmul(i, mult);
00100     return rthal_uldivrem(ull, div, NULL);
00101 }
00102 
00103 static inline __attribute_const__
00104 unsigned long long __rthal_ullimd (const unsigned long long op,
00105                                    const unsigned long m,
00106                                    const unsigned long d)
00107 {
00108     u_long oph, opl, tlh, tll, qh, rh, ql;
00109     unsigned long long th, tl;
00110 
00111     __rthal_u64tou32(op, oph, opl);
00112     tl = rthal_ullmul(opl, m);
00113     __rthal_u64tou32(tl, tlh, tll);
00114     th = rthal_ullmul(oph, m);         /* op * m == ((th + tlh) << 32) + tll */
00115     th += tlh;                         /* op * m == (th << 32) + tll */
00116 
00117     qh = rthal_uldivrem(th, d, &rh);   /* op * m == (qh * d + rh) << 32 + tll */
00118     th = __rthal_u64fromu32(rh, tll);  /* op * m == (qh * d) << 32 + th */
00119     ql = rthal_uldivrem(th, d, NULL);  /* op * m == (qh * d) << 32 + ql * d + ?*/
00120     return __rthal_u64fromu32(qh, ql); /* (op * m) / d == qh << 32 + ql */
00121 }
00122 
00123 static inline long long rthal_llimd (long long op,
00124                                      unsigned long m,
00125                                      unsigned long d)
00126 {
00127 
00128     if(op < 0LL)
00129         return -__rthal_ullimd(-op, m, d);
00130     return __rthal_ullimd(op, m, d);
00131 }
00132 
00133 static inline unsigned long ffnz (unsigned long ul) {
00134 
00135     __asm__ __volatile__ ("cntlzw %0, %1" : "=r" (ul) : "r" (ul & (-ul)));
00136     return 31 - ul;
00137 }

00177 #define rthal_cli()                     adeos_stall_pipeline_from(&rthal_domain)
00178 #define rthal_sti()                     adeos_unstall_pipeline_from(&rthal_domain)
00179 #define rthal_local_irq_save(x)         ((x) = !!adeos_test_and_stall_pipeline_from(&rthal_domain))
00180 #define rthal_local_irq_restore(x)      adeos_restore_pipeline_from(&rthal_domain,(x))
00181 #define rthal_local_irq_flags(x)        ((x) = !!adeos_test_pipeline_from(&rthal_domain))
00182 #define rthal_local_irq_test()          (!!adeos_test_pipeline_from(&rthal_domain))
00183 #define rthal_local_irq_sync(x)         ((x) = !!adeos_test_and_unstall_pipeline_from(&rthal_domain))

00188 #define rthal_hw_disable()              adeos_hw_cli()

00199 static inline void rthal_spin_lock_irq(spinlock_t *lock) {
00200 
00201     rthal_cli();
00202     rthal_spin_lock(lock);
00203 }
00204 
00205 static inline void rthal_spin_unlock_irq(spinlock_t *lock) {
00206 
00207     rthal_spin_unlock(lock);
00208     rthal_sti();
00209 }

00211 static inline unsigned long rthal_spin_lock_irqsave(spinlock_t *lock) {
00212 
00213     unsigned long flags;
00214     rthal_local_irq_save(flags);
00215     rthal_spin_lock(lock);
00216     return flags;
00217 }
00218 
00219 static inline void rthal_spin_unlock_irqrestore(unsigned long flags,
00220                                                 spinlock_t *lock) {
00221     rthal_spin_unlock(lock);
00222     rthal_local_irq_restore(flags);
00223 }

00225 #if !defined(CONFIG_ADEOS_NOTHREADS)
00226 
00227 /* Since real-time interrupt handlers are called on behalf of the RTAI
00228    domain stack, we cannot infere the "current" Linux task address
00229    using %esp. We must use the suspended Linux domain's stack pointer
00230    instead. */
00231 
00232 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_get_root_current (int cpuid) {
00233     return ((struct thread_info *)(adp_root->esp[cpuid] & (~8191UL)))->task;
00234 }
00235 
00236 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_get_current (int cpuid)
00237 
00238 {
00239     register unsigned long esp asm ("r1");
00240     /* FIXME: r2 should be ok or even __adeos_current_threadinfo() - offsetof(THREAD) */
00241     
00242     if (esp >= rthal_domain.estackbase[cpuid] && esp < rthal_domain.estackbase[cpuid] + 8192)
00243         return rthal_get_root_current(cpuid);
00244 
00245     return current;
00246 }
00247 
00248 #else /* CONFIG_ADEOS_NOTHREADS */
00249 
00250 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_get_root_current (int cpuid) {
00251     return current;
00252 }
00253 
00254 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_get_current (int cpuid) {
00255     return current;
00256 }
00257 
00258 #endif /* !CONFIG_ADEOS_NOTHREADS */

00260 static inline void rthal_set_timer_shot (unsigned long delay) {
00261 
00262     if (delay) {
00263 #ifdef CONFIG_40x
00264         mtspr(SPRN_PIT,delay);
00265 #else /* !CONFIG_40x */
00266         set_dec(delay);
00267 #endif /* CONFIG_40x */
00268     }
00269 }

00290 typedef struct rthal_fpenv {
00291     
00292     /* This layout must follow exactely the definition of the FPU
00293        backup area in a PPC thread struct available from
00294        <asm-ppc/processor.h>. Specifically, fpr[] an fpscr words must
00295        be contiguous in memory (see arch/ppc/fpu.S). */
00296 
00297     double fpr[32];
00298     unsigned long fpscr_pad;    /* <= Hi-word of the FPR used to */
00299     unsigned long fpscr;        /* retrieve the FPSCR. */
00300 
00301 } rthal_fpenv_t;
00302
